meaning_cn: 能表达清楚的，善于表达的
definition: express (an idea or feeling) fluently and coherently
example: They were unable to articulate their emotions.

meaning_cn: 证明（某个行动过程）正当（或必要）
definition: justify or necessitate (a certain course of action)
example: There is not enough new evidence to warrant a reference to the Court of Appeal.

meaning_cn: 猛烈的，激烈的；激进的，极端的
definition: likely to have a strong or far-reaching effect; radical and extreme
example: Many employees have had to take drastic cuts in pay.

definition: very ordinary and therefore not interesting
example: Mundane matters such as paying bills and shopping for food do not interest her.

definition: mention (a number of things) one by one
example: There is not space to enumerate all his works.

meaning_cn: （范围，规模，程度）巨大的，庞大的
definition: remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree
example: He had a prodigious appetite for both women and drink.

definition: make (someone) annoyed, impatient, or angry
example: It's his arrogance that really irritates me.

definition: something that is a mixture of two very different things
example: His work is an interesting hybrid of popular and classical music.

meaning_cn: 博学的人，杰出的科学家
definition: learned person, especially a distinguished scientist
to please someone, or to satisfy a wish or need
example: He was gratified to see how well his students had done.

definition: a countless or extremely great number
example: Myriads of insects danced around the light above my head.

definition: imitate the appearance or character of
example: Red ochre was used to simulate blood.

definition: to get or make use of something
example: For more than a century, Eastern cities have expanded their water supplies by tapping ever more remote sources.

meaning_cn: （人或动物）强壮的；（东西或系统）坚固耐用的，结实的
definition: strong and healthy, or strong and unlikely to break or fail
example: The formerly robust economy has begun to weaken.

definition: a system in which people or things are arranged according to their importance
example: He rose quickly through the political hierarchy to become party leader.

definition: complying or willing to comply with orders or requests; submissive to another's will
example: She was totally obedient to him.

definition: a lack or shortage
example: During the war children suffered from a deficiency of food.

definition: free from disturbance; calm
example: She stared at the tranquil surface of the water.

definition: feel deep pleasure or satisfaction and convey it through one's expression and bearing
example: Katy always glowed when he praised her.

definition: lift or haul (a heavy thing) with great effort
example: She heaved the sofa back into place.

definition: develop rapidly and successfully
example: The organization has continued to flourish.

definition: strongly encourage or urge (someone) to do something
example: The media have been exhorting people to turn out for the demonstration.

definition: showing or feeling active opposition or hostility towards someone or something
example: He was antagonistic to the government's reforms.

definition: spread or cause to spread over a wide area or between a large number of people
example: The problem is how to diffuse power without creating anarchy.

meaning_cn: （意义、表情或声音的）细微差别；微妙的变化
definition: a subtle difference in or shade of meaning, expression, or sound
example: Nuances of flavor and fragrance cannot be described accurately.

definition: with reference to; in relation to; concerning
example: With respect to your other proposals, I am not yet able to tell you our decision.

definition: congregate or mass in a flock or large group
example: Young men flocked about her.

meaning_cn: 表明（尤指理论或抽象概念）
definition: an event, action, or object that clearly shows or embodies something, especially a theory or an abstract idea
example: These are the first obvious manifestations of global warming.

definition: make to increase rapidly in numbers; multiply
example: Science-fiction magazines proliferated in the 1920s.

definition: rise and fall irregularly in number or amount
example: Trade with other countries tends to fluctuate from year to year.

definition: full of energy and enthusiasm
example: The hope is that this area will develop into a vibrant commercial centre.

definition: totally bewilder or perplex
example: The unexplained occurrence baffled everyone.

meaning_cn: （尤指任务、过程或旅行）费时费力的
definition: requiring considerable effort and time
example: The work is very slow and laborious.

definition: run away from (someone or something)
example: All remaining doubt that he was a guerilla began to flee my mind.

definition: give attention or consideration to (an idea, suggestion, or feeling)
example: Washington entertained little hope of an early improvement in relations.

meaning_cn: 取消；终止；解除（合作或婚姻关系等）
definition: annul or put an end to (a partnership or marriage)
example: Their marriage was dissolved in 1968.

definition: give official permission or approval for (an action)
example: The council will consider whether to sanction the operation.

definition: assert something as a position in an argument
example: He contends that the judge was wrong.

definition: eliminate something completely
example: The plague had wiped out whole villages.

definition: produce or generate, especially in large numbers
example: The decade spawned a bewildering variety of books on the forces.

definition: requiring much skill or effort
example: She has a busy and demanding job.

definition: conspicuously uninvolved and uninterested, typically through distaste; cool and distant
example: He stayed aloof from the bickering.

meaning_cn: 不注意的，未察觉到的，不关心的
definition: not aware of or not concerned about what is happening around one
example: She became absorbed, oblivious to the passage of time.

definition: absorb all the attention or interest of
example: What is it about Harry Potter that so engrosses children?
